attributes.action: Reduce the amount of school holidays a year
attributes.additional_details: Because this is no longer an age where women stay at home to raise the family. Women now work and only get the standard 22 days holiday a year, which is impossible to cover the 13 weeks children get in the UK and puts immense pressure on families, to pay a fortune in alternative child care costs, which most families can not afford.
attributes.background: Reduce the amount of school holidays and inset days children in the UK have. Id like the Government to scrap the February and October half term and also reduce the 6 weeks holiday to 2 weeks or at the most 3 weeks.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about dates for school holidays are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to require all local authorities to open state-maintained schools for a certain number of weeks each year, but you'd need to be clear what requirements for opening you wanted the Government to impose.
